physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Symmetrical weakness of shoulder and hip girdle muscles (MRC grade 4), anterior leg compartment muscles (MRC grade 4-), scapular winging bilaterally, absent ankle reflexes on both sides, high-arched feet, hammertoes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At initial evaluation 10 years ago, ankle reflexes were intact and there was no ankle dorsiflexor weakness. Recent deterioration noted with absent ankle reflexes.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Needle EMG revealed small and rapidly recruiting motor unit potentials with fibrillation potentials in deltoid, biceps, iliopsoas, and gastrocnemius. EKG showed normal sinus rhythm and suggested left atrial enlargement.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mildly elevated CK level possibly indicating progression of myopathy.
